entry.title: Example Post
entry.content:
This is an example post, written in Markdown.

You can create your posts' content using plain text combined with Markdown syntax.

The following is a non-exhaustive example of the basic markup codes and how they render in HTML. See this Markdown cheatsheet for more examples and other syntax.

View markup 
# Heading 1
## Heading 2
### Heading 3

---  

This text is **bold**.  
This text is *italicized*.  
Here's a [link](https://www.example.com)  

> This is a blockquote. 

Ordered list
1. First item
2. Second item
3. Third item

Unordered list
- One
- Two
- Three

This is some inline `<code>`

\```
<p>
  This is a code block (remove the leading \ )
</p>
\```

### Images  
![An image of a dog](https://placedog.net/300 "A glorious dog")  

Your own images can be used by placing them in the `./src/assets/img/posts` directory and linked in your Markdown using `/assets/img/posts/{image}` as the location.

### Tables  
| Column 1 | Column 2 | Column 3 |
| -------- | -------- | -------- |
| Some data 1 | Some data 2 | Some data 3 |
| Some data 4 | Some data 5 | Some data 6 |

Heading 1

Heading 2

Heading 3

This text is bold.
This text is italicized.
Here's a link

This is a blockquote.

Ordered list

  1. First item
  2. Second item
  3. Third item

Unordered list

  • One
  • Two
  • Three

This is some inline <code>

<p>
  This is a code block
</p>

Images

Your own images can be used by placing them in the ./src/assets/img/posts/ directory and linked in your Markdown using /assets/img/posts/{image} as the location.

Tables

Column 1 Column 2 Column 3
Some data 1 Some data 2 Some data 3
Some data 4 Some data 5 Some data 6
